thread.title: Pearson, UMD Tabbed No. 12 in NSIC Poll
thread.title_full: Pearson, UMD Tabbed No. 12 in NSIC Poll

title: Pearson, UMD Tabbed No. 12 in NSIC Poll
text:
Pearson, UMD Tabbed No. 12 in NSIC Poll 
By Zach Schneider Pearson, UMD Tabbed No. 12 in NSIC Poll   7:23 PM CDT 
Duluth, MN (NNCNOW.com) --- First-year head coach Mandy Pearson and the University of Minnesota Duluth (UMD) women's basketball team have been picked 12th in the Northern Sun Intercollegiate Conference (NSIC) preseason coaches' poll, which was released on Wednesday afternoon. 
Winona State was picked as the league's preseason favorite, receiving eight of a possible 15 first-place votes. UMD was also picked this year to finish sixth in the NSIC North Division. 
Click here to subscribe to our daily newsletter. 
For full results of this year's NSIC women's basketball preseason coaches' poll, click here. 
The Bulldogs did have the original NSIC North preseason player of the year in Taylor Meyer, but she will be receiving a medical redshirt after undergoing offseason knee surgery. 
UMD's key returner, then, will be sophomore forward Anna Monke, who averaged 4.0 points and 3.6 rebounds per game last season while playing in all 27 contests for the Bulldogs. 
Pearson's first season in charge officially started last week with practice, with UMD's first official game scheduled for Nov. 14 against Michigan Tech.
